result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley N Bladl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Letter received from Atty William Gergen
Copy of Receipt

Def in person & by Atty William Henry Gergen.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State. Defendant has deposited $1,133.49 in Atty. Gergen's Trust Account; DA has contacted victim to determine reestitution amount. At the time Atty. Gergen is advised of the restitution amount, their office will forward check to the District Attorney's Office. Court proceeds to sentencing - $442 fine to be paid within 90 days or judgment.
Sentencing hearing at 07-09-2015 11:00 am

Def in person & by Atty William Henry Gergen.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement reached w/separate sentencing date requested as is free to argue and to allow time for State/counsel to investigate restitution issue.  State moves to amend Ct 1 to Misd Theft, 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a); Court so orders.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  On amended Ct 1 State recommends 5 mos Co Jail w/huber imposed/stayed, 1 yr probation, $243 court costs, counseling per agent, restitution of $1151.49.  Statements from counsel - def will be paying restitution up front once amount is decided upon and offer may then be joint recommendation.  Def enters no contest plea to amended Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1.  Jury trial set 6-29-15 removed from calendar.  Court admonishes def re terms of bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.
State's Discovery Demand

One day jury trial set.    The Court orders all motions, including motions in limine,  be filed on or before the jury status date.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
